results.abstract: spend 83 minutes outside Salyut 6 space laboratory on 171st day of orbit; dismantle exterior equipment in preparation for return to earth (M)

headline.main: Soviet Astronauts Spend 83 Minutes Outside Craft; Men Growing Homesick

results.snippet: MOSCOW, Aug. 15 (AP) Two Soviet astronauts who have been in orbit in the Salyut 6 space laboratory for a record 171 days made an 83-minute excursion today to dismantle exterior equipment in preparation for their return to earth.
results.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Aug. 15 (AP) Two Soviet astronauts who have been in orbit in the Salyut 6 space laboratory for a record 171 days made an 83-minute excursion today to dismantle exterior equipment in preparation for their return to earth.

headline.main: Books: Adventurous Life Of Eddie Rickenbacker

results.lead_paragraph: LIKE a modern astronaut, Eddie Rickenbacker should have been regarded as the epitome of the American hero: dashing, a me chanical wonder on the ground and an adventurer in the air, and an inspiration for American youth. Up to a point, he was all of these things.

results.abstract: Article on what US hopes to learn from Soviet space effort (M)

headline.main: U.S. Expects To Learn From Soviet Space Effort; U.S. Awaits Soviet Findings Other Concerns

results.snippet: THE two Soviet astronauts who lived for six months 200 miles above the earth in a compartment the size of a small house trailer are expected to provide biologists and physi  cians with a wealth of scientific data about living and working in space.
results.lead_paragraph: THE two Soviet astronauts who lived for six months 200 miles above the earth in a compartment the size of a small house trailer are expected to provide biologists and physi cians with a wealth of scientific data about living and working in space.

headline.main: Books of The Times Metaphors in Medicine; Vastness Brings Confusion

results.snippet: What distinguishes "The Body in Question" is Jonathan Miller's deftness and originality in using metaphors to clarify so accurately much of the biological basis of medicine. Rarely have metaphors been used so well to communicate complex medical...
results.lead_paragraph: What distinguishes "The Body in Question" is Jonathan Miller's deftness and originality in using metaphors to clarify so accurately much of the biological basis of medicine. Rarely have metaphors been used so well to communicate complex medical concepts and to pay tribute to the magnificence of the human body.
